text.p: General Abdul Rashid Dostum, a potential rival to Afghanistan's Taleban militia, and ousted President Burhanuddin Rabbani met and embraced on a highway near here on Tuesday and proceeded in a convoy to a military base for talks.

The meeting followed a report from a senior Afghan diplomat that Dostum, who commands troops in northern Afghanistan, would join forces with Rabbani in resisting the advance of the fundamentalist Taleban.

Hundreds of Dostum soldiers were standing in uniform at attention with their weapons along the road into the city. Rabbani also met a group of several hundred city dignitaries and army officials standing on one side of the highway.
After the highway formalities Dostum and Rabbani climbed into a limousine for the ride to the Kala Jangy base west of the city.
Before he met Rabbani, Dostum told reporters he would prefer not to answer any questions until Rabbani spoke.

"Let us wait until the president is here and let him speak and then i will answer your questions," Dostum said, adding: "Masood will come today or if he cannot make it today then tomorrow," a reference to Rabbani's military commander Ahmad Shah Masood who has dug in and is facing Taleban forces near the Panjsher Valley.
